name: heyoo

name: anitrophaeron
text: I get kinda choked up when I think about how important giving his word is to Beef, and how Ray then regards that as equivalent to giving his own word.

name: mygoodfriend
text: I thought this was a part of Ray and Beef's act.

name: zeal
text: I think it's Beef playing on the act he knows Ray will put on as soon as he starts trying to pass himself off as So-Rod.  He knows Ray will try to act the heroic lone warrior, so he maneuvers around that.

name: zeal
text: Also I'm pretty sure the second rogue from the left is Danny Trejo in cat form.

name: rasalghul
text: Ha!  Breaking Bad Season 2, around ep. 6 or 7 I realized this man deserves the respect of having his name remembered by such as myself.  He is a dude from circumstances.

name: anzio
text: Hell yes, Breaking Bad is the best TV show.

name: diggidy
text: I doubt Ray would legitimately say "A Stubbs stands alone", even if he was truly referring to a Smuckles. Therefore I think it likely that the entire speech is scripted.

name: ojnabieoot
text: I don't think it's part of an act.  Look how horrified Ray looks when he learns that Beef gave his word.  He ain't that good of an actor.  I agree with zeal on this one; Beef doesn't want to see his best friend attempt to go it alone.  As far as diggidy's comment goes, I think Ray saying "A Stubbs stands alone" is indicative of him getting caught up in his legacy rather than attempting to establish a reputation.

name: justa
text: Word, man. These guys are bros straight up.

name: paco
text: the really fat-ass guy with the clown hair has the same medallion as Ray.

name: drago25
text: I love how Ray switches immediately from deep ZZZZZ sleep to badass

name: direhaggis
text: The tallest cat reminds me of No-No from the afterlife. Same eyes, expression, lanky build. Lacking in the murder act inclination and foot cast, though.

text: And giant briefs/diaper.
